alert.note: Alert for La Salle; Livingston (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 4:15PM CDT until July 08 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central Illinois and north central Illinois, including the following counties, in central Illinois, Livingston. In north central Illinois, La Salle. * WHEN...Until 715 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 413 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen, with isolated higher amounts. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in localized areas. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Streator, Peru, La Salle, Marseilles, Oglesby, Seneca, North Utica, South Streator, Tonica, Grand Ridge, Cornell, Lostant, Ransom, Rutland, Cedar Point, Kangley, Long Point, Dana and Leonore. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
